paper_abstract: The method of change (or anomaly) detection in high-dimensional discrete-time processes using a multivariate Hotelling chart is presented. We use normal random projections as a method of dimensionality reduction. We indicate diagnostic properties of the Hotelling control chart applied to data projected onto a random subspace of R-n. We examine the random projection method using artificial noisy image sequences as examples.
paper_title: RANDOM PROJECTIONS AND HOTELLING'S T-2 STATISTICS FOR CHANGE DETECTION IN HIGH-DIMENSIONAL DATA STREAMS
